detailed_info.name: Stearyl alcohol
detailed_info.description:
Stearyl alcohol or Octadenol is a fatty alcohol. It is used in cosmetics as an emulsifier (which helps water and oil to mix). It forms cetyl alcohol (CETYL ALCOHOL) with cetearyl alcohol (CETEARYL ALCOHOL). Stearyl alcohol is allowed in organic.

The CIR (Cosmetic Ingredient Review) in an annual report published in 2006, concluded the safety of stearyl alcohol.

functions.name: Emulsifying
functions.description: Promotes the formation of intimate mixtures between immiscible liquids by modifying the interfacial tension (water and oil)

functions.name: Emulsion stabilising
functions.description: Promotes the emulsification process and improves the stability and shelf life of the emulsion

functions.name: Foam boosting
functions.description: Improves the quality of the foam produced by increasing one or more of the following properties: volume, texture and/or stability

functions.name: Masking
functions.description: Reduces or inhibits the odor or basic taste of the product

functions.name: Opacifying
functions.description: Reduces transparency or translucency of cosmetics

functions.name: Refatting
functions.description: Restores lipids in hair or in upper layers of the skin

functions.name: Surfactant
functions.description: Reduces the surface tension of cosmetics and contributes to the even distribution of the product when it is used

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

functions.name: Film forming
functions.description: Produces a continuous film on skin, hair or nails
